nodes.text: Aye, it be an old sea chest. And it looks to be in ship-shape condition.
If by ship-shape, you mean one that's been shipwrecked and battered upon the reefs beyond the sea caves.
Dusty, crusty, and rusty.
There's no point in taking it anywhere. I could just take what's in it...
... if there was anything still inside to take.
There's no point in taking it anywhere. I can just take what's in it. Much easier that way.
A liberal application of oil could help with the rusty parts. Won't do anything for the crusty stuff though.
Of course, it is locked. Still, how hard can it be to pick an old lock?
Okay, this is harder than it looks.
Good thing I oiled this lock before I tried this. I could have broken something - like my lockpick.
There it goes!
I knew I should have practiced my lockpicking more before coming here.
The lock seems to have rusted solid.
Now let see what was hidden under all the rust and crust...
What's this? It looks like a clay tablet with some markings on it.
It's a Frigida Runestone. It looks a lot like the one that I made in Magic Class.
It feels very cold to the touch. I'll bet it is magical.
Ooh, this is good - a Healing Potion.
Looks like around 50 Lyra for me.
It's empty. I've no one to blame but myself.
